department: College of Computing and Digital Media
biography: Bill Connor is a Chicago-based filmmaker and sound designer. He has a BA in English from Case Western in Cleveland and an MFA in Cinema Production from DePaul University in Chicago. He has written and directed several award-winning films including "A Favor, "The Red Wheelbarrow," and "Bento Box." He is also the founder of Icebox Post-Production where he designs and mixes sound for short films, documentaries, corporate videos, and podcasts. Recent clients include Sesame Street, JASH, and TED.
